DataElement.preferredName: Participant Imaging Procedure Agreement American College of Radiology Storage Future Research Consent Ind
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A yes/no response as to whether the participant agreed with the protocol plan and consented to allow the ACR to store his/her medical images for future research.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Participant Imaging Technique Agreement American College of Radiology Storage Future Research Activity Consent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Someone who takes part in an activity._Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy._The act of agreeing to a plan, protocol, or arrangement. Also used to describe a harmony of opinion._An FDA-designated accrediting body that includes radiologists, radiation oncologists and medical physicists. The ACR focuses its activity on making imaging safe, effective and accessible trough its accreditation programs, research, and development of guidelines for quality imaging, and education._The act of safekeeping goods in a depository._A time that is yet to come._Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, establish or revise a theory, or develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered._Permission to do something.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Someone who takes part in an activity.

Concepts.definition: Someone who takes part in an activity.

Property.preferredName: Imaging Technique Agreement American College of Radiology Storage Future Research Activity Consent
Property.preferredDefinition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.:The act of agreeing to a plan, protocol, or arrangement. Also used to describe a harmony of opinion.:An FDA-designated accrediting body that includes radiologists, radiation oncologists and medical physicists. The ACR focuses its activity on making imaging safe, effective and accessible trough its accreditation programs, research, and development of guidelines for quality imaging, and education.:The act of safekeeping goods in a depository.:A time that is yet to come.:Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, establish or revise a theory, or develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered.:Permission to do something.

Concepts.definition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.
The act of agreeing to a plan, protocol, or arrangement. Also used to describe a harmony of opinion.

An FDA-designated accrediting body that includes radiologists, radiation oncologists and medical physicists. The ACR focuses its activity on making imaging safe, effective and accessible trough its accreditation programs, research, and development of guidelines for quality imaging, and education.
The act of safekeeping goods in a depository.
A time that is yet to come.
Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, establish or revise a theory, or develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: I agree to have my scans stor
ReferenceDocuments.description: I agree to have my scans stored at the central imaging facility at the American College of Radiology for use in possible future research.

DataElement.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form
